name: machine-learning
description: Advanced machine learning and MLOps with production-ready pipelines, multi-agent orchestration, comprehensive experiment tracking, and enterprise data infrastructure. v1.0.3 enhances /ml-pipeline command with 3 execution modes (quick/standard/enterprise), adds data-engineer agent, and provides 6-file external documentation covering MLOps methodology, deployment strategies, monitoring frameworks, and success criteria.
changelog: v1.0.3: Enhanced /ml-pipeline command with YAML frontmatter (3 execution modes: quick 2-3 days, standard 1-2 weeks, enterprise 3-4 weeks), added data-engineer agent for enterprise data infrastructure, agent reference table for 7 specialized agents (4 native + 3 optional cross-plugin), condensed phase descriptions with external doc links, comprehensive 6-file documentation suite (mlops-methodology.md covering maturity models and CI/CD, pipeline-phases.md with detailed implementation checklists, deployment-strategies.md for canary/blue-green/shadow/A-B testing, monitoring-frameworks.md for drift detection and observability, best-practices.md for production readiness, success-criteria.md with quantified KPIs). Enhanced usability with clear execution paths, graceful fallback for missing agents, and complete reference library. Maintains 100% backward compatibility.

agents.name: data-engineer
agents.description: Expert data engineer specializing in scalable data pipelines, ETL/ELT architecture, data quality frameworks, and production data infrastructure for ML systems

agents.name: data-scientist
agents.description: Expert data scientist with 6-phase chain-of-thought reasoning framework (problem analysis → data assessment → methodology selection → implementation → validation → communication), constitutional AI self-correction for statistical rigor and business relevance, structured output templates, and 3 detailed few-shot examples for advanced analytics, ML modeling, statistical testing, and business insights

agents.name: ml-engineer
agents.description: Expert ML engineer with 6-phase production engineering framework (requirements → system design → implementation → optimization → deployment → operations), constitutional AI principles for reliability/observability/performance, structured output with architecture diagrams and runbooks, and 2 detailed few-shot examples for scalable ML systems with PyTorch 2.x, TensorFlow, model serving, A/B testing, and performance optimization

agents.name: mlops-engineer
agents.description: Expert MLOps engineer with 6-phase infrastructure framework (requirements → architecture → implementation → automation → security → operations), constitutional AI principles for automation/reproducibility/cost-efficiency, structured output with IaC templates and cost analysis, and comprehensive few-shot example for complete MLOps platforms with Kubeflow/MLflow, GitOps, CI/CD, and multi-cloud deployment across AWS/Azure/GCP

commands.name: /ml-pipeline
commands.description: Design and implement production-ready ML pipelines with multi-agent MLOps orchestration, 3 execution modes, and comprehensive external documentation
commands.improvements: v1.0.3 Enhancement: Added YAML frontmatter with 3 execution modes (quick: 2-3 days MVP with core agents, standard: 1-2 weeks full pipeline with monitoring, enterprise: 3-4 weeks complete MLOps platform with K8s), added data-engineer agent, agent reference table for 7 specialized agents, condensed phase descriptions with external doc links, comprehensive 6-file documentation suite (MLOps methodology covering maturity models and CI/CD practices, pipeline phases with detailed implementation checklists, deployment strategies for canary/blue-green/shadow/A-B testing, monitoring frameworks for drift detection and observability, best practices for production readiness, quantified success criteria with KPIs). Enhanced usability with AskUserQuestion for mode selection, graceful degradation for optional cross-plugin agents, --docs-url support for library-specific guidance, and complete reference library without increasing command token cost.

skills.name: statistical-analysis-fundamentals
skills.description: Comprehensive statistical analysis workflows including hypothesis testing, Bayesian methods, regression analysis, experimental design, A/B testing, and causal inference

skills.name: machine-learning-essentials
skills.description: Core machine learning workflows including classical ML algorithms (regression, trees, ensembles), neural networks, model evaluation, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment

skills.name: data-wrangling-communication
skills.description: Data wrangling, cleaning, feature engineering, and visualization workflows for preparing data and communicating insights effectively

skills.name: advanced-ml-systems
skills.description: Advanced deep learning systems with PyTorch 2.x, TensorFlow 2.x, distributed training (DDP, DeepSpeed, FSDP), hyperparameter optimization, model optimization (quantization, pruning, distillation), and transfer learning

skills.name: ml-engineering-production
skills.description: Production ML engineering practices including software engineering fundamentals, testing strategies, data pipelines, SQL integration, code optimization, version control, and collaboration workflows

skills.name: model-deployment-serving
skills.description: Model deployment and serving with FastAPI, TorchServe, BentoML, Docker, Kubernetes, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure), monitoring, drift detection, and A/B testing

skills.name: devops-ml-infrastructure
skills.description: DevOps and ML infrastructure automation with GitHub Actions CI/CD pipelines, Terraform infrastructure as code, AWS/Azure/GCP provisioning, inference optimization, and deployment automation

skills.name: ml-pipeline-workflow
skills.description: Build end-to-end MLOps pipelines with Airflow, Dagster, Kubeflow Pipelines, or Prefect orchestrating data preparation, feature engineering, model training, validation, and production deployment workflows
